metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9645 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.Description:
The add_probe function in modutils/modprobe.c in BusyBox before 1.23.0allows local users to bypass intended restrictions on loading kernelmodules via a / (slash) character in a module name, as demonstrated by an"ifconfig /usbserial up" command or a "mount -t /snd_pcm none /" command.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9645` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

busybox - 1:1.22.0-15ubuntu1
busybox-initramfs - 1:1.22.0-15ubuntu1
busybox-static - 1:1.22.0-15ubuntu1
busybox-syslogd - 1:1.22.0-15ubuntu1
udhcpc - 1:1.22.0-15ubuntu1
udhcpd - 1:1.22.0-15ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: busybox package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:1.22.0-15ubuntu1').
